thread.title: What you may have missed: A chronological recap of the Utes' first loss through the Twitter lens
thread.title_full: What you may have missed: A chronological recap of the Utes' first loss through the Twitter lens | Deseret News

author: Ryan McDonald
title: What you may have missed: A chronological recap of the Utes' first loss through the Twitter lens
text:
Recapping the highs, lows and BYU trolling that took place on Twitter during the University of Utah's 42-24 loss to USC on Saturday.
Upcoming Games Utah Football Utah football stats & schedule Ore. St. @ Utah Rice-Eccles Stadium, Salt Lake City Oct. 31, 5:00 p.m. 5 Days 3 Hrs 44 Mins 12 Secs More Coverage The 2015 Heisman Trophy tracker, Week 8: Former Logan High star shoots up the list College football: Utes slide in latest Coaches Poll Without watching a given game, one can typically figure out what’s happening in that contest by scanning social media, particularly Twitter.
Such was the case Saturday during the University of Utah’s 42-24 loss to USC , the Utes ’ first loss of the season. “Utah football Twitter” began as a happy place at kickoff time, but before long it became a location of frustration and ultimately a venue that was full of BYU fans trolling Ute faithful.
A chronological recap of the game through the Twitter lens:
FIRST QUARTER:
Utah had fallen behind 7-0 halfway through the frame thanks to a 9-yard run from Justin Davis, but all was pretty quiet on the Ute Twitter front.
Then with just under four minutes remaining, Utah quarterback Travis Wilson connected with Britain Covey on a reception, and the diminutive freshman fought his way for a 30-yard touchdown to tie things up.
Britain Covey, you fantastic tiny Mormon, you.
— Mark Armstrong (@ArmstrongABC11) October 25, 2015
Just two minutes later, the Trojans were forced to punt, and Covey made them pay with this beautiful return:
Watch Britain Covey make some magic with this punt return. Utah scored on the next play. pic.twitter.com/5WPJafwWB1
— Dr. Saturday (@YahooDrSaturday) October 25, 2015
Twitter went nuts, and the Utes scored on the next play to take a 14-7 lead.
A four foot tall soccer midfielder from Utah is clowning USC on a punt return right now, Trojans have to close their football program now
— SPENCER HALL (@edsbs) October 25, 2015
Britain Covey out there being a man and whatnot.
— Ashley Adamson (@AdamsonAshley) October 25, 2015
#MightyMouse showing some moves! Oh wow!!
— N8 the Spoon (@utefan99) October 25, 2015
It's too bad Covey isn't a D-1 player.
— Brad Pierce (@UTAHSportsBar) October 25, 2015
I am going to delay every flight that tries and take Covey to his mission after the season.
— benji (@BiH_Benjo) October 25, 2015
SECOND QUARTER
If the wheels on the bus had been going round and round, they started to fall off for Utah about four minutes into the frame as Wilson threw the first of four interceptions (three of which went to freshman linebacker Cameron Smith) on the night, and USC scored less than a minute later to tie things up at 14.
Like with the Trojans’ first score of the game, folks didn’t get too riled up about Wilson’s mishap. Seven minutes later, however, USC led 21-14, and Wilson threw another pass to Smith, which he took 54 yards to the end zone to make it 28-14.
Cameron Smith is going to boot Utah out of the playoff at this rate. Wow.
— Pat Forde (@YahooForde) October 25, 2015
Maybe Travis Wilson has a medical condition where he can't see people named Cameron
— SPENCER HALL (@edsbs) October 25, 2015
On the Utes’ next possession just before halftime, Wilson took a sack that pushed his team to the edge of field goal range. Twitter responded.
Travis Wilson is NOT having a good half. Good gravy.
— Pat Forde (@YahooForde) October 25, 2015
We need to sell our soul for a quarterback
— Michael Bodell (@mikebodell1978) October 25, 2015
